item.title: Trump Eyes High-Profile Wall Street, D.C. Veterans for Treasury Secretary
item.description: The former president and his aides view experience in finance as a key factor in the selection.

item.title: Gold Rises to Record High, Boosted by Rate-Cut Expectations
item.description: Gold prices rose to record highs as a softer U.S. inflation reading last week boosts hopes that the Fed will kickstart its rate-cutting cycle in June.

item.title: Oil Edges Higher as U.S. Inflation Data Boosts June Rate-Cut Hopes
item.description: Oil prices edged higher after U.S. Fed Chair Jerome Powell said last week that the latest inflation data align with what the central bank would like to see, bolstering market bets for a June rate cut.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 1.4%, Dragged by Chip, Financial Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended lower, dragged by falls in chip-related and financial shares.

item.title: Japan's 10-Year JGB Auction on Tuesday May Attract Good Demand
item.description: Japan’s 10-year JGB auction on Tuesday may attract good demand from investors, given it’s the start of the new fiscal year, Citi said.

item.title: USD/IDR May Test Last Year's Peak of 15,965.00 This Week, Chart Shows
item.description: The anticipated strength of USD/IDR has exceeded UOB’s expectations and the currency pair continues to rise.

item.title: Crypto FuelsRussian Shadow Trade for Weapons Parts
item.description: How Russian middlemen used the cryptocurrency tether to avoid U.S. sanctions and procure parts for drones and high-tech weapons.

item.title: The Stock Market's Magnificent Seven Is Now the Fab Four
item.description: Some investors say it is a bullish signal that the market is rallying without the likes of Apple and Tesla because it means other groups are taking part.

item.title: Chinese E-Commerce Giant Squeezes Workers With Noncompete Agreements
item.description: Temu parent PDD enforces a culture of corporate secrecy by suing some former employees.

item.title: The Celebrity Chef Who Beat the U.S. Military at Getting Aid Into Gaza
item.description: As the Pentagon embarks on a project to create a maritime aid route, José Andrés’s World Central Kitchen has already begun delivering food by sea.

item.title: Why Boeing's Quality Controls and Plane Safety Checks Still Miss Mistakes
item.description: Boeing was given 90 days to present regulators with an action plan to address quality-control issues at its 737 factory. Here’s a look at the layers of Boeing’s quality process and the issues each faces.

item.title: Business owners are resisting the Republican state lawmakers who are trying to deter migrants from illegally entering the U.S. by making it tougher for them to find work.
item.description: Business owners are resisting the Republican state lawmakers who are trying to deter migrants from illegally entering the U.S. by making it tougher for them to find work.

item.title: Turkey's main opposition party was poised to control most of the country's largest cities while claiming a surprise victory in local elections that represent a rebuke to President Erdogan, reflecting discontent with the country's turbulent economy.
item.description: Turkey’s main opposition party was poised to control most of the country’s largest cities while claiming a surprise victory in local elections that represent a rebuke to President Erdogan, reflecting discontent with the country’s turbulent economy.

item.title: Pressure is building on Netanyahu over tough decisions that could strain the prime minister's coalition and threaten his grip on the management of Israel's war with Hamas.
item.description: Pressure is building on Netanyahu over tough decisions that could strain the prime minister’s coalition and threaten his grip on the management of Israel’s war with Hamas.

item.title: China's manufacturing sector returned to expansion in March after five months of decline, adding to signs of a stabilizing economy.
item.description: China’s manufacturing sector returned to expansion in March after five months of decline, adding to signs of a stabilizing economy.

item.title: Some U.S. lawmakers backing a crackdown on TikTok worry that overly broad Senate changes to a House proposal to ban the app or force its sale could significantly delay the effort or derail it altogether.
item.description: Some U.S. lawmakers backing a crackdown on TikTok worry that overly broad Senate changes to a House proposal to ban the app or force its sale could significantly delay the effort or derail it altogether.

item.title: Tupperware delayed its annual results due to internal control issues and a shortage of accountants.
item.description: Tupperware delayed its annual results due to internal control issues and a shortage of accountants.

item.title: A congressional race in Iowa is testing whether the national uproar over in vitro fertilization will help Democrats win in November and potentially tip control of the House in their favor.
item.description: A congressional race in Iowa is testing whether the national uproar over in vitro fertilization will help Democrats win in November and potentially tip control of the House in their favor.

item.title: "Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire" notched the second-biggest domestic weekend opening at the box office of a movie so far this year.
item.description: “Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire” notched the second-biggest domestic weekend opening at the box office of a movie so far this year.

item.title: Engineers began the complicated and painstaking process of clearing the wreckage of Maryland's Francis Scott Key Bridge after it was struck by a ship and collapsed.
item.description: Engineers began the complicated and painstaking process of clearing the wreckage of Maryland’s Francis Scott Key Bridge after it was struck by a ship and collapsed.
